content.description: It’s a simple scramble up with a couple of different ways to get up but if your looking for and adventure you will scramble your way up from the left. You take a simple lightning bolt route up which can be an interesting journey if your scared of sharp rocks below. Just kidding. The crux would be the transition form the flat ledge to the upper part of the lightning bolt where you have a crack that you
content.location:
This one’s pretty tricky but if you follow the lost valley road for 6.6 miles you will turn on a bend. You can follow the trail up and on the top of the trail there will be some communication tower to the left. Bush wack your way over there and boom you are at the boulder!

here are the coordinates for the start of the trail: (33.3741896, -116.5750684)

content.description:
Problem is a crack that runs all the way up the wall. Crux is the first couple moves. Kinda awkward and sketch cause there's a pretty thorny bush right below the boulder.

This problem is named for the man, the myth, the legend Robert the SWAT Officer. He's alive today cause death is too afraid of him. He can kill you before you'd even know what happened. He is the inspiration for Horst in the Pixar film Ratatouille.
content.location: 8 miles from the Lost Valley Scout Camp on Lost Valley Rd. The boulder is located just off the road. Bush wack a bit and you'll see Robert's Crack.

content.description: Slopey moves up the arete then a super nice jug at the finish.
content.location: Approximately 1 mile from Lost Valley Scout Camp.
